fields.description:
stree command line tool doesn't work.

it is critical to me!
fields.summary: stree command line tool doesn't work
Open Sourcetree from command line with a path no longer works

fields.description:
When using Dark Theme on Mac:

!image-2018-10-25-15-44-53-183.png!

 

The text cursor is extremely difficult to see when typing in the commit message box:

!image-2018-10-25-15-44-43-387.png!
fields.summary: [Dark Mode] Black text cursor is very hard to see

fields.description: Since the 3.0 version, Sourcetree can't seem to be able to open links to checkout quickly from Bitbucket
fields.summary: If I click on checkout in sourcetree from bitbucket, sourcetree doesn't open it anymore

fields.description: When Dark Theme is selected I keep having the last repos I used highlighted in pink. It doesn’t happen when the Light Theme is selected.
fields.summary: Pink highlighting on the recently clicked repositories list

fields.description:
Just upgraded to the new version of Sourcetree for Mac.

And discovered that there is a number badge on the commit button.

For me it's totally useless and really annoying since it draws attention.

Pleas make this badge optional in settings.
fields.summary: Make the badge on the commit button optional

fields.description:
Having upgraded to Sourcetree 3.0 I am now unable to see the cursor while typing a commit message. I use the dark theme (both before and after upgrade).

 

To reproduce:
 # Ensure Sourcetree is in dark theme mode under preferences
 # Press commit
 # Observe the cursor is in black
 # Type something and backspace a few times, you cannot see where you are

 

This was not the case in 2.0.

 

Please change back to a colour that is easier to see again the dark blue.
fields.summary: Unable to see cursor in Sourcetree 3.0 when writing commit message in Dark theme

fields.description:
Hello, i'm just a regular user of sourcetree and want to suggest an improvement. For me, will be so much easier if i could search my tags and branchs typing somewhere(like a search bar above "File Status"). I have here about 10000 tags and branches and i falled in love with sourcetree kinda view, so looking into "git bash", the black screens etc is boring af. Looking foward for my new version with my simple search bar. Thank you!

With love, 

 

Tales Pacheco
fields.summary: Create an easier interface for TAG/BRANCH manual searching

fields.description:
Creating branches based upon Jira issues is great. You get to see the relevant issue ID and the project on which it relates.

But the pure alphabetical ordering is really unhelpful.

So please sort the branch names naturally.
fields.summary: Use natural ordering of branch names

fields.description:
When clicking on "pull", a dialog opens in order to select the remote repository and remote branch. The dialog used to be prefilled with the repository and branch which are tracked by the local branch.

With version 3.0.0 the branch is no longer preselected and the list of branches is empty. It's only populated after clicking explicitly on refresh.

!Pull-no-branch.png!

This makes day-to-day routine work much more awkward.
fields.summary: Pull does not select tracked remote branch

fields.description: Several labels/buttons are cut off in the Preferences when using the German localization (plus an unlocalized label). See the attached screenshot, the cut off elements are marked.
fields.summary: Several strings are cut off in Preferences
SourceTree Mac 3.0 no longer opens repository window when passed `open` command is issued.

fields.description:
Since upgrading to SourceTree 3.0, the 'stree' command no longer opens the project of the current directory. I've also tried 'stree .', but still all that opens is the SourceTree window with the Drag and Drop a repository. I've tried reinstalling the command line tools and also logging out and back in, but the behavior is consistently broken.

 

stree --version reports version 1.3

 

Also, it seems that Open Recent also fails to open the projects, so the issue may not be related to stree but to a bug in SourceTree opening projects.

 

I am able to open a project with Cmd+O and navigating in that dialog.
fields.summary: stree command no longer opens the project

fields.description:
After installing version 3, stree no longer open the repo on the directory it is called

 

*Steps*

cd path/to/repo

stree

 

*Current outcome*

Opens Sourcetree bookmarks if closed. If open, it only brings it forward.

 

*Expected outcome*

Opens Sourcetree and displays the repo window of the curent repo
fields.summary: `stree` command no longer working on Sourcetree 3
opening sourcetree from terminal with directory as parameter doesn't work

fields.description:
In version 2.7.8 I can drag and drop a repository to open it:
 * on to the application folder icon
 * on to the dock icon
 * on to the application switcher icon

  In version 3.0.0(200) no drag and drop methods work

NB -  In the bug reporter I have selected the most recent version3.0b5 - but the 'about sourcetree' version is 3.0.0(200), which is not selectable here.
fields.summary: drag and drop to open a repositiory is broken on Version 3.0(200)

fields.description: With sourcetree command line tools installed, run "stree ." on the command line. Instead of opening the current working directory in sourcetree, it simply opens sourcetree without any project. Prior to sourcetree 3.0, this worked as described.
fields.summary: sourcetree 3.0: running "stree ." on command line no longer opens cwd

fields.description:
The {{Parents}} entry in the commit info pane wrap after 2 commits, this pushes the {{Author}} entry down, but not the label (see attachment).

At first I thought it was only displaying the first 2 commits, since the diff pane only shows the diff of the first two commits (SRCTREEWIN-3860 is not specific to Windows)
fields.summary: Octopus merges cause cosmetic issue
i can't run sourcetree on my mac, some recent repos always showing in sourcetree even i uninstall and install also it's keep on showing application not respond

fields.description:
I suggest add a $REMOTE variable, which is current push/pull remote name, eg `{{origin}}` `{{upstream}}`.

So that I can do

{{  git push $REMOTE +$BRANCH}}

When I rebased my feature branch.

 

_Related issues:_
 * _$BRANCH as in [#SRCTREE-2979]_
 * _$ACCOUNT as in [#SRCTREE-2771]_
fields.summary: Requesting $REMOTE variable in Custom Actions parameters

fields.description:
I just updated to 3.0.

The `stree` command seems to be broken, as in, previously, I was able to pass in the path to a repo and Sourcetree would open with the repo at the specified path. This no longer works.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 # `/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/stree /path/to/git/repo`
 # Sourcetree only gets focus but nothing happens.

Expected results:
 * Sourcetree should open the repo of which the path was passed as an argument to the `stree` command.

Actual results:
 * Sourcetree only gets focus but nothing happens.

 

More info:

Sourcetree app version: 3.0 (200)

```

$ /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/stree -v
 stree version 1.3

```
fields.summary: `stree /path/to/repo` fails since Sourcetree v3.0 (200)
Column resize causes other dividers to move

fields.description:
Starting with "Git flow -> Initalize Repository", I type in (custom) desired labels for 'feature'/'release'/'hotfix' as:

feature/JH/

feature/ 

hotfix/JH/

 

Initialisation seemingly works, but when I do "Git flow -> Start new feature", the resulting new branch is "feature/branch_name" not the expected/desired "feature/JH/branch_name". 

In addition, in the "Git flow -> Start new feature" dialog, the 'Preview' shows nothing.
fields.summary: Git-flow prefix labels not working as expected
pull notification is not refresh automatically when my friend push into master

fields.description:
Help->Release notes menu item opens Safari to [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/releasenotes/3.0.html#version-3.0]

which shows:
h1. Not Found

The requested URL /update/releasenotes/3.0.html was not found on this server.
----
Apache/2.2.22 (Ubuntu) Server at sourcetreeapp-fe.internal.atlassian.com Port 80
fields.summary: Help->Release Notes menu item navigates to a bogus URL
Source tree remote settings are displaying a red exclamation mark - for private SSH remote access

fields.description:
Hello

In version 3.0.6, Sourcetree gets stuck in pulling. The output it's the following:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
 fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 Ya se agreg� un elemento con la misma clave.

error: cannot spawn C:\Users\bperdomo\AppData\Local\Sourcetree\app-3.0.6\tools\Askpass.exe: No error

 

This error doesn't happen on the 2.6.10 version

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Error pulling a repository

fields.description: After updating macOS to 10.14 the overlay counter on the pull/push toolbar buttons are missing.
fields.summary: Pending changes overlay missing in macOS Mojave

fields.description:
Hello,

Since a few days, every branches in all my projects have the wrong name.

When I go on the website (bitbucket), everything is ok. But when I start SourceTree, the branches names aren't good. 

As you can see in this screenshot, I'm on the branch TPGWEB-1626 but in the Graph, it only display FEAT_. 

!image-2018-10-08-15-49-56-399.png!

If I click on the branch in the sidebar, it works. But if I click on a commit, it doesn't work.

!image-2018-10-08-15-51-29-083.png!

 

It's like this in every project, but in 90% of my branches. Sometimes, it still shows the full name.

What am I doing wrong ?
fields.summary: Wrong branch name in the Graph

fields.description:
When "Show Full Output" is selected for a custom action, after the action has completed, I am unable to close the panel via either of the the two standard hotkeys "Command-W" and "Escape".

Also, the window close button is disabled for some reason.

(I tried uploading a screenshot, however there was an error "Jira could not attach the file as there was a missing token.")

I am able to close via a "Close" button, but even using this feature dozens of times every day, I inevitably only click the button after first trying one of the standard system wide hotkeys.
fields.summary: Unable to close "Full Output" panel with standard hotkey

fields.description:
Creating a stash, even though I enter a name in the dialog (e.g., Temp), it doesn't display on the list of stashes – showing instead "0", see attached image.  Looks like broken pointer?

Also, it takes really, really long for the stash to complete.  I was previously on a Mac version of SourceTree and the stash was nearly instantaneous.  On Windows, it takes about 20 seconds.

Possibly related: I also created story SRCTREE-6130 due to the inability to stash at all with the embedded Git.
fields.summary: Stash shows "0" instead of name in list of stashes

fields.description:
When I attempt a stash, it fails with the error below.  I tried updating the embedded Git (per this article https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-cannot-clone-pull-anymore-sh-exe-stackdump/qaq-p/82962#U909013) and though it finished without error, the version was never updated as displayed.  I tried the update a second time with the same result.  So I downloaded Git to another location and switched SourceTree to System.  That allowed me to actually stash without error, albeit, very slowly.

Error:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c credential.helper= -c credential.helper="C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/ATLASS~1/SOURCE~1/GIT_EX~1/GIT-CR~1.EXE" stash save Embedded
 1 [main] sh 1880 fork: child 1640 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
 C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/mingw32/libexec/git-core\git-stash: fork: retry: Resource temporarily unavailable

1255322 [main] sh 1880 fork: child 19464 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
 C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/mingw32/libexec/git-core\git-stash: fork: retry: Resource temporarily unavailable
 3519673 [main] sh 1880 fork: child 2420 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
 C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/mingw32/libexec/git-core\git-stash: fork: retry: Resource temporarily unavailable
 7743623 [main] sh 1880 fork: child 19684 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
 C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/mingw32/libexec/git-core\git-stash: fork: retry: Resource temporarily unavailable
 15994075 [main] sh 1880 fork: child 15068 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
 C:/Users/barnesr/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_local/mingw32/libexec/git-core\git-stash: fork: Resource temporarily unavailable

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Stash fails with an error

fields.description:
At Apache Royale project we're in the process to generate a 0.9.4 release. The work is done by other committer (Om) and I'm using SourceTree in my machine.

We received the following email:

Subject: 
h2. [royale-asjs] annotated tag org.apache.royale.framework-0.9.4-rc1 updated (29713a0 -> 25c496e)
 
 
 
content:

 

This is an automated email from the ASF dual-hosted git repository.

carlosrovira pushed a change to annotated tag org.apache.royale.framework-0.9.4-rc1
in repository [https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/royale-asjs.git].


*** WARNING: tag org.apache.royale.framework-0.9.4-rc1 was modified! ***

    from 29713a0  (commit)
      to 25c496e  (tag)
 tagging 29713a03b0d2bf47f9db5f98a93c47902c716b86 (commit)
 replaces apache-royale-0.9.2
      by Om
      on Mon Oct 1 00:50:39 2018 -0700

- Log -----------------------------------------------------------------
[maven-release-plugin] copy for tag org.apache.royale.framework-0.9.4-rc1
-----------------------------------------------------------------------


No new revisions were added by this update.

Summary of changes:

 

========

This happen two times. I'm sure I did do nothing, so it seems for me a bug in SourceTree, due to the release manager creating and removing branches to get the release done.
fields.summary: SourceTree Application updating tags on its own

fields.description: I don't understand what the problem is, let me know if there's logs or something like that if it helps. I love using Sourcetree but it just gets slower and slower every day. Every time I click I have to wait for many seconds before anything reacts, the whole app hangs constantly, even just trying to scroll through the changes in one file is impossible, it just doesn't scroll.
fields.summary: The app is just unusable now, seems like every update makes it worse instead of better

fields.description:
When I go to the remote tab and refresh the list of repositories I always get the error message “Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed” for my GitHub account. The Error Contents has the following text:

“The operation couldn’t be completed. ([com.google|http://com.google/].GTMOAuth2 error - 1001.).

Signing in again doesn’t help. Refreshing still fails. When I cancel the Sign In everything seems to work however, so I’m not sure what’s going on.

I have two external accounts set up. One for Bitbucket and one for GitHub, I have the same username on both services, so maybe it’s somehow related to that?

I've also got 2 factor auth enabled for both accounts, not sure if that makes a difference?
fields.summary: The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error - 1001.)

fields.description:
In short, in the Search tab results the background and text color of active items that are not in focus are not consistent with the rest of the app, and are illegible (see images)

Steps:
 * click Search under WORKSPACE
 * search for something that returns results
 * click on one of the results

At this point, the list of modified files will show up below, with the first file in the list highlighted by default. The background color of this list item is white, with white text on top. This is not legible. 

If you click on this list item, the background color turns blue and the text is also blue. Not as bad, but still inconsistent with the rest of the app. 

This behaviour can also be observed on both the selected search result item and the selected file at the same time when the Sourcetree window is not in focus.

Based on the style on the History page for example, I believe the colors of the text should be swapped on the search results page: white when background is blue, blue when background is white.
fields.summary: Dark theme search results page highlight contrast issue when item not in focus

fields.description:
Sorry, my English is not very good。I from China.
I use the latest version of MACOS and the latest version of sourceTree。Before that, there will be a simple flow chart here.Now I reinstalled the software and re-imported the project. But it is still like this.
fields.summary: When I use Git flow, the preview interface is blank.

fields.description:
Hey

I am trying to finding source tree linux setup but it seems, it is only available for windows and Mac.

 I know this is not appropriate project to request this feature but is there any specific reason that is not available or may be, I am not aware of the way to deploy it in Linux.
fields.summary: SourceTree linux desktop

fields.description:
After trying to sign into Bitbucket from Sourcetree using OAuth via Google, I get redirected every time to the Bitbucket homepage after I confirm the sign in attempt via two factor authentication using Gmail (get a notification from Gmail and you tap the "Yes" button" to confirm the login attempt was valid).

Expected: login attempt completes

Actual: goes to Bitbucket home page and there is no way to continue, only cancelling.

Get the same result if I try to login using the more commonly used numeric 6 digit code from an authenticator app. Been trying to login using SSH instead but so far it's not working.

Also tried turning off two factor authentication on my Google account and it's still not working (still getting redirected to Bitbucket home page instead of finishing the login).

!Untitled.png|height=500!
(redacted)
fields.summary: OAuth Sign in to Bitbucket with Two Factor Auth redirects to Bitbucket home page instead of finishing

fields.description:
I'll very often click on something in the side menu in SourceTree, such as "File status" and the current view in the main part of the window does not change. For example right now I am looking at a list of commits and I just clicked on "File status" and nothing happened. Then if I click on something else and then back on "File status" then I see the "File status" page. This happens for stashes, branches, etc. Does not happen every time, or else I haven't found a consistent series of steps to reproduce yet.

I have had this problem for a while, at least over the past year or more, updating SourceTree for macOS consistently.
fields.summary: SourceTree I sometimes have to click on a side menu option multiple times to get it to load

fields.description: When using Dark appearance in macOS Mojave *and* Dark theme in Sourcetree, progress bars are virtually invisible - they seem to be using some bluish tint that is not visible at all in dark mode, in dark mode.
fields.summary: Blue progress bars almost invisible in macOS's Dark mode

fields.description:
When I click on the Settings button of a repository, all I get is the Mac spinning wheel. From there on, SourceTree seems to hang. I have to Force Quit the application to get out of that state.

I can reproduce this for every of my Git repositories, whether that be Github, Bitbucket or GitLab.
fields.summary: Spinning wheel when opening repository settings
Font colour for remote groups is dark in "Dark Theme"

fields.description:
{color:#000000}I’m seeing extremely high CPU usage (up to 115% according to Activity Monitor) using Sourcetree 3 Beta (198) on macOS High Sierra (10.13.6). This happens even when there are no Sourctree windows open.{color}
 
I’ve seen this happen before on an older macbook using the current stable release of Sourcetree so it’s disappointing to see that it happens again with the new version.
 
Even when the CPU usage goes down it doesn’t seem to go below ~25%, which still seems unreasonable. This is draining my MacBook’s batteries and is deterring me from using Sourcetree at all.
 
(I previously reported this on the Beta Group mailing list, but was asked by Manjunath Basaralu Srinivasa to open a new ticket with a spindump. I was unable to create a spindum, so I've attached a sample instead.)
fields.summary: High CPU and memory usage on Mac OS

fields.description:
As soon as _Parameters_ contains a quote mark ", the entire content of _Parameters_ gets surrounded by quotes.

To reproduce:
 # Create a Custom Action:
|_Show Full Output_|✓ Yes|
|_Script to run:_ |{{sh}}|
|_Parameters:_|{{-c "echo Hi"}}|

 # Execute the Custom Action

It executes 
{code}
sh "-c "echo Hi""{code}
Expected it to execute 
{code}
sh -c "echo Hi"{code}
 

Possibly related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1158
fields.summary: Custom Action: Quotes in Parameters: Everything gets quoted
Sourcetree keeps crashing on start MAC

fields.description:
Buen día ,

 

No permite acceder a los repositorios genera error, anexo pantalla.
fields.summary: No se conecta a los repositorios

fields.description:
After some time using Sourcetree I feel it is a nice tool but the UI in some parts seems to me a little bit poor.

I would change things like:
 * Changing Checked out branch colour to better distinguish it. For example: If there are several branches aligned to an specific commit and there is one branch checked out, it is useful to be able to distinguish it easily.
 * Improving Dark theme. I have tried it and colours are not that good in my opinion. I would check dark theme colours from apps like SublimeText, Atom or Intellij and try to improve Sourcetree Dark theme.
 * Tree graph is somehow difficult to follow compared to other tree graphs (check out gitx Tree graph). And It could even contain some information in each circle such in GitKraken. I would also align it to the center as when having only 1 line as a tree it is aligned to the left making it less visible.
 * I would another search option suc in gitx where a user can search in the full list of commits for a keyword, say Atlassian and then all commits containing in the commit message that keyword are highlighted in a different colour

 

Hope this suggestions help in making event better this great tool!
fields.summary: UI Possible Improvements
Support AWS CodeCommit Multi-Factor-Authentication

fields.description:
Neither Sourcetree 3.0 nor Sourcetree 2.7.6 currently support the native dark mode in macOS 10.14 Mojave. The current dark mode in Sourcetree is using a different color scheme than the default color scheme of AppKit elements in macOS. Sourcetree is also not switching to dark mode and back to light mode when the system appearance is changing.
I would suggest replacing the current dark mode in Source Tree with the default AppKit implementation and color schemes for Sourcetree installations running on macOS 10.14 Mojave.
fields.summary: Support native macOS 10.14 Mojave dark mode

fields.description:
The diff view of Sourcetree doesn't show any colors anymore, all highlights are presented in a grey overlay. Hard to work with when looking a differences.

!Screen Shot 2018-09-15 at 12.36.57.png|width=542,height=63!
fields.summary: Diff viever colors grey instead of green/red

fields.description:
The colour of the flashing cursor in the commit message window when using the dark theme is almost invisible.

It is even harder to see when you've typed something and you need to move around the window to edit the message.
fields.summary: Cursor is almost invisible in dark theme when typing commit message

fields.description:
I've got a similar problem as described in SRCTREE-5988 (which has been marked as resolved with beta 6). SourceTree crashes, as soon as I open the Repository Browser. A crash report is attached.

I do not know if SourceTree 3.0b6 will crash during regular use all the time (as 3.0b5 did), but I will report on that.
h4. Edit:

It does crash during regular use. Additional crash report is attached. Seems to be an unexpected null-reference exception.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes When Opening the Repository Browser

fields.description:
When you pull from remote, there's popup window saying:

 

Fetching branch `branch_name` from `origin`

 

While its Chinese translation literally means:

 

Fetching branch `origin` from `branch_name`

!Unknown.png!
fields.summary: Translation wrong when pulling from remote branch

fields.description:
I was browsing our Gitlab via the Repository Browser and cloned a project from there. Then SourceTree crashed on me. I got a crash report for that (see attached file, Sourcetree_2018-09-12-114827_MetalBookPro.crash).

After some restarts and consecutive crashes, I was left with just one tab/window of my 10+ tabs that I had open before. Every time I open the Repository Browser, SourceTree crashes, with a similar exception.

Maybe this is related to the repository I cloned, but I cannot tell from the crash report. Not having any log files (see SCRTREE-5950) is not really helpful, either.

I can open all repositories via CMD + O and work with them without any problems. However, opening the Repository Browser will crash SourceTree after second or two.

 
h4. Edit:

Now SourceTree crashes without any interaction, and I also got a new crash report (see Sourcetree_2018-09-12-145734_MetalBookPro.crash). SourceTree crashed multiple times in a row, now it seems to work again..
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on clone via/open Repository Browser

fields.description: When trying to log in the interface is buggy, please see screenshots. For the email login no password field appears and for the google account login there is no account to choose.
fields.summary: cant log in

fields.description:
*Description:*

When dragging the left border of the diff view to the right (effectively making the diff view smaller), the sidebar will sometimes begin to resize unexpectedly until it takes up the full width of the SourceTree window.

This resizing only happens once the diff view has reached a certain minimum size, and is reversed if the user drags in the opposite direction. It is, however, quite erratic and the sidebar will resize at a rate that is faster than the user is actually moving the mouse.

A video of the bug is attached 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open SourceTree and select the *History* view.
 # Click and drag on the border between the pending file view and the diff view and drag it to the *right.*
 # Continue dragging, as if trying to hide the diff view entirely.
 # Notice that once the diff view has reached a certain minimum size the sidebar will also begin to resize.  The sidebar will expand at a rate that appears to be twice as fast as the diff view is shrinking
 # Eventually the sidebar becomes so large it takes up the entire SourceTree window.
fields.summary: Resizing the code diff view causes sidebar to resize unexpectedly

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS from version 1.0b2 before version 3.0.0 before version 3.0.0, via Git subrepositories in Mercurial repositories. An attacker with permission to commit to a Mercurial repository linked in Sourcetree for macOS is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.

 

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/v00SOQ]
fields.summary: Remote Code Execution in Sourcetree for macOS, via Mercurial repo with Git subrepo - CVE-2018-13396

fields.description:
open Prefs: General

Toggle the Theme

Open Diff tab

EXPECTED: diff colors are unchanged or updated to the theme default

OBTAINED: Colors are set to black
fields.summary: Diff colors reset to all black when Theme is toggled (Light<->Dark)
Menu options `File->Open` and `Window->Open repository Browser` have the same keyboard shortcut

fields.description:
We have custom cherry-pick defined in Custom Actions (we need to review changes before committing them) which also creates .git/MERGE_MSG file, but the prepared commit message is not reflected in Sourcetree (commit message textarea in Sourcetree is empty). I believe ST doesn't check if this file was created or not after performing Custom Action.

Could ST check for that file after every Custom Action is performed and if it exists, prefill ST's commit message textarea with content of that file?

Thanks.
fields.summary: ST doesn't respect .git/MERGE_MSG after Custom Action

fields.description:
In SourceTree 2.5.3, when a commit message contained a commit SHA, it would be rendered as "URL-clickable" and take you to the given commit in History view when clicked.

 

This is no longer the case en SourceTree 3.0 (196).
fields.summary: Commit SHA in commit message no longer clickable

fields.description: Sometimes a remote can have a very large amount of branches that clutter the view. Usually I am only interested in the few branches that I have tracked by local branches. I would like to be able to "Show tracked branches" in addition to "Show/Hide remote branches"
fields.summary: Show only tracked remote branches

fields.description:
I went through the setup and successfully logged into my Atlassian account. I'm stuck at the following screen though:

!Screen Shot 2018-09-06 at 14.09.02.png|width=371,height=258!

When I press "Continue" nothing happens. Quitting and restarting SourceTree does not help. Problem persists. I'm unable to use Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Welcome wizard stuck at login screen

fields.description:
Unable to setup source tree from fresh install. 
Continue button after logging into Atlassian account does nothing.
fields.summary: Sourcetree setup fails after atlassian ID login when behind VPN

fields.description:
While merging two branches (to main branch), if there is a local change on main branch, sometimes it cant be seen on File Status screen. After refreshing or fetching the main branch, we are able to see there is a changed file locally and we have to discard it or not. 

 

Could it be possible that while merging any two branches, Sourcetree fetches the main branch and controls whether there is any changes and ask users to discard them or not? (like changing the branches when there is a change)

 

Because of this we always have to fetch the main branch, discard them and lastly merge them (sometimes doing it from the start again and again...).
fields.summary: Suggestion: Cant merge two branches without discarding local changes

fields.description: I click the "Terminal" button and immediately I get the rainbow spinning circle and "Application Not Responding". Then I need to force quit from SourceTree. !Screen Shot 2018-09-04 at 12.39.33 PM.png!
fields.summary: Can't open the Terminal from the SourceTree GUI

fields.description:
This is a request to reopen SRCTREE-4200.

This issue still exists as another user has reported. In fact I have been upgrading source tree over the course of the past year I've been using it and this bug has always been there.

Please let me emphasize how "critical" this bug is towards productivity. From a software perspective "is there a work around, etc, etc" yes. Of course. But please understand that SourceTree & SCM is "Productivity Software". It exists SOLELY to make productivity better. Enhancements for all sorts of crazy use cases is awesome, but 98% of the time users use SourceTree / Git, it is to check in code. That's like so vanilla of a use case that we just take it for granted that it just works. This bug is soooo frustrating every time because if I have to select 2 files to check in, it doubles the time it should take me to do a check in. If I have 10 files, it's a 10x tax. If I need 100 files its 100x. The more files we need to check in, the MORE we need productivity software. But ironically this bug scales linearly with the value that SourceTree provides.

This is simply a plea to appropriately consider the "criticality" and priority of this bug from the total value loss perspective. It's a shame that a the image of a very very solid product is tainted in my mind due to a very minor bug that affects me 98% of the time I use the software. 

Thank you in advance for your consideration and providing this wonderful software.
fields.summary: (Still exists)SourceTree loses scrolling position when making changes in staging area

fields.description:
When on Bitbucket, I create a new branch and use the 'Check out in source tree' feature but on the 'Checkout Existing' popup that comes up, the remote branch field shows that i'm checking out only for a couple seconds at most before suddenly changing to 'default'. 

If I don't press the 'Checkout' button almost instantly on this popup before it switches to default, I get an error that 'default' is not a valid commit and I have to restart the process, which is nearly every single time on the first attempt of when I check out a new branch from Bitbucket.

I tore through all of the settings multiple times and found nothing that seems to affect this, and searched online a few times with a few different phrases of the issue and it seems no one else has this issue.

I provided two screen caps of it normally (i had to take it fast so it wasn't as clean), and then one it after it switches.
fields.summary: Using 'Check out in Source Tree' from BitBucket, the 'Remote branch' field changes to "default" after a second

fields.description:
I tried re-installing SourceTree and re-installing OSX. This isn't working for the stable build either.

Worth mentioning may be that I have access to way more than 100 repos through my Github account. 

See screenshot.
fields.summary: Github OATH not working

fields.description: When I'm trying to add my GitLab CE account, it seems that Tab key doesn't work properly. After filling out our server URL pressing the Tab key does nothing, when I try to fill out Username and Password fields I can jump just between them using Tab key.
fields.summary: Tab key doesn't work as expected in GitLab CE account addition

fields.description:
Commit text isn't showing.

Tried deleting the application and installing the latest. But problem still shows.

 

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/temporaryattachment/8a2185bb7a5d8e4f6a66cca4ae43c4a9ab4c979c/temp2557079818568317130_Screen%20Shot%202018-08-30%20at%2011.56.05%20am.png|width=527,height=425!

 

Many thanks for your help awesome Atlassian team!!
fields.summary: Text of all commits in history has disappeared, not showing

fields.description: It seems that log files are not created. When I select Open Logs Folder from Debug menu, it opens ~/Library/Logs/Sourcetree, but there is last log file from August 10th, 2018, and no sign of log from today.
fields.summary: Log files are not created

fields.description:
h5. Behavior
# Open the Sourcetree app
# A pane will be displayed
# Can not click the 'Continue' button, because it'll never be activated
fields.summary: Can not click the 'Continue' button on the first pane
Add subfolders in the Local tab

fields.description:
I can't add my GitLab CE account for our GitLab CE server which is accessed over HTTPS with SSL client certificate. GitLab CE user accounts are validated against LDAP/ActiveDirectory.

FIrst, after filling out the form (see {{gitlabce_form.png}}) and pressing {{Add}} button I'm getting this error (see {{gitlabce_error.png}}).
 Second, it doesn't seem that form does allow change of {{Auth Type}}.
fields.summary: Issues with adding account for GitLab CE server accessed over HTTPS with SSL client certificate

fields.description:
If you provide a option to launch external diff tool instead of launching editor on double click in "file status" view that would be superb. 

I usually restore the unrelated reformat changes that made by editor (rider, vscode eg) before commit the code. SourceTree diff log is not helpful as other diff tools.
fields.summary: Launch external diff tool on double click

fields.description:
I get this message very often when using sourcetree:
{quote}An unexpected error has occurred: CalledProcessError: Command: ('/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/libexec/git-core/git', 'write-tree')

Return code: 128

Expected return code: 0

Output: (none)

Errors:

    fatal: Unable to create '/Users/sam/project/.git/index.lock': File exists.

    

    Another git process seems to be running in this repository, e.g.

    an editor opened by 'git commit'. Please make sure all processes

    are terminated then try again. If it still fails, a git process

    may have crashed in this repository earlier:

    remove the file manually to continue.
{quote}
Usually trying again once or twice, it will work.

This looks to also be present on the Windows version of sourcetree, see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5639

I wonder therefore if this is some architecture problem with sourcetree?

This is on latest Sourcetree, 2.7.6
fields.summary: Unable to create '.git/index.lock': File exists.

fields.description:
* Open SourceTree.
 * Go to full screen (green button)
 * Make some changes in your project
 * Get ready to commit using Cmd+Shift+C
 * Press esc because you changed your mind

Expected behavior:

The commit screen closes

Actual behavior

Full screen is closed, the commit screen is still there
fields.summary: When full screen, in commit window pressing ESC closes full screen instead of commit window

fields.description:
Within the 'Delete Branches' dialog box, it would be useful to have a branch name search box that filters the branches that match the search criteria.

I run a git repository that has many branches local and upstream in the origin remote, as well as a handful of other remote repositories. Due to this, finding and ensuring I delete the right branch(es) can be difficult. An option to search branch names would be useful so I can filter only the branches appropriate branches.
fields.summary: Add ability to search branch names within the 'Delete Branches' dialog

fields.description:
h4. Observed behaviour:

When I ran into an error message regarding the new GitlabCE integration, I tried to get more output via logging. I wanted to change the log level from _debug_ to _verbose_. However, I cannot change the log level at all, it always stays at _debug_, regardless of what I select. Maybe this is intentional, but then the option should not show. In addition, when I opened the logs folder of SourceTree (~/Library/Logs/Sourcetree), I found it to be empty.

 
h4. Expected behaviour:
 * When I change the log level, it is actually changed.
 * There are logs in the logs folder.
fields.summary: Log level cannot be changed

fields.description: Like the 'fork' app, !image-2018-08-20-10-37-16-757.png!
fields.summary: can view the details of work copy at work copy list

fields.description:
# click the connect button on the sourceTree
 # choose the Bitbucket, Auth Type: Oauth
 # click connect account
 # after the login, redirect me to the repos page, which show me a "cancel" button at the bottom?
 # then? what should I do to finish the connect via OAuth?
fields.summary: Can not connect the bitbucket account via oAuth.

fields.description:
Please add support for Gitmoji https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/

1. Show emoji instead of gitmoji "shortcuts" in history
2. Help user select correct gitmoji when creating commit message when user types ":"
fields.summary: Support for Gitmoji

fields.description:
the setup dialog (configure Bitbucket /github account) has too short text areas for the german texts.  the headline is being cut in the middle of the window and the intro text allows just two lines but the german text is longer. so the end is missing.

weird how this can even happen at a company with the best development tools and programmers.
fields.summary: dialog textfields too short

fields.description:
When I rename remote repository alias, Sourcetree loses information about remote branches and tracking of branches. I need to refetch that repository and set correct tracking.

{{git remote rename <old> <new>}} does not do that.

This is related SRCTREE-5439 because ST doesn't allow to name remote repository during clone of repository.

This is same bug as SRCTREEWIN-9051.
fields.summary: Renaming remote repository alias loses information about remote branches and tracking

fields.description:
I would suggest removing the icons in Source trees bookmark menu. Or perhaps making it an option.

I'ver been using source tree for the past 4 years and now have many repositories in the menu. I use the grouping to categorize the repos but with a large number of repos the menu is hard to scan. I believe that removing the icons would:
 * Reduce vertical space for menu items allowing for easier comparison between the first character for scanning
 * Reduce visual noise, the color of the icons interferes with hierarchy in the list as it itself is not very important but is treated as such (first in order, colored vibrantly)

Thanks for your hard work and great product!
fields.summary: Remove Icons in Bookmarks Display

fields.description: There is repository with roughly 5500 comits (started around 10 years ago). WIth SourceTree is virtually impossible to see older comits (one of the first) as it constantly refreshes and redreaws the view jumping to the top and loosing focused commit.
fields.summary: Reading older commits
Error when continuing interactive rebase

fields.description:
Currently there is no easy way to detect file moves or renames. TortoiseHG has this feature implemented, but it lacks the possibility to manually force rename or move of specific file/files (haven't tested newest versions).

It would be awesome if I could select from the file context menu in SourceTree to manually link the file that was renamed/moved and in the menu a option to do a batch job for mass rename/move including scanning tampered files outside of SourceTree.

I'm working usually with maintenance projects and there these features come in handy, eg old project needs to be reorganised for future development. Another use-case would be for new developer who messed up initial project layout.
fields.summary: Detect file moves or renames

fields.description: When viewing a repo in SourceTree for macOS tooltips do *not* display for truncated values in the sidebar on the left (workspace, branches, tags, remotes, stashes, submodules, subtrees). Current workaround requires manually dragging the sidebar to the right enough to reduce/eliminate truncated values. It would be great to be able to simply hover over truncated values in the sidebar to view the full non-truncated value.
fields.summary: Sidebar tooltips not working
Latest ST on MacOS 2.7.6 (177) Authentication hanging not completing

fields.description:
I connected a github account (some day back in v2.x), with an SSH key. Now I was happy to find out that there is an option to create such an account for Gitlab CE as well! However, it does not work. :( If I fill out all the details (as you can see in the attached screenshot *– err, how can I attach a picture?* ), nothing happens when I press save. In addition, if I click the "Copy to clipboard" button, a new dialogue will open and ask me to generate a new SSH key.

The id_rsa.pub contains a valid ssh key. The "Copy to Clipboard" button works fine for my github account, though.
fields.summary: Gitlab CE SSH profile does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sourcetree doesn't list  all remote repositories up in Bitbucket Server.
Some repositories aren't displayed in the list even though the repository exists.
Of course, a user can clone the repository.

There are huge repositories, over 30000 repositories, in the Bitbucket server. 

Windows version Sourcetree has same a behavior.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# login Bitbucket Server, which has huge repositories.
# Press Remote button on Sourcetree
# Filter some repositories

h3. Expected Results
List the repository up

h3. Actual Results
Not list the repository up
 
h3.Workaround
clone to local
fields.summary: Sourcetree doesn't list all remote repositories up in Bitbucket server

fields.description:
When I want to stage several files I highlight them all to stage them at the same time. Sourcetree automatically has to stop for a while to compute the diff for every file and show it all in the diff panel to the right. This can really slow down when images are involved too.

It would be nice to have an option to only diff when single files are selected.
fields.summary: Add option to disable diff when multiple files are selected

fields.description:
From today cannot access to git from terminal or Sourcetree.

fatal: HttpRequestException encountered.
 An error occurred while sending the request.

remote: Invalid username or password. If your organization manages your account or you've enabled two-step verification, create an app password to log in: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/9DJmMQ]

 

Creating and use app password don't make any affect. From bitbucket.org web portal - everything is ok.
fields.summary: git auth problem

fields.description:
Made an ugly checkin mistake w/ a merge conflict by doing this:

1) switch list of changes to Conflicts

2) made changes to the file to resolve the conflicts

3) right clicked on file to resolve the conflict and chose "Use Theirs" by mistake instead of "Mark Resolved" and didn't get a confirmation

4) file disappeared from Conflicts view

5) I didn't look at the file again to confirm and merged it
fields.summary: when resolving merge conflict, "Use Theirs" should warn if you modified the file

fields.description:
SourceTree -> Preferences -> Accounts Tab

Connect account button pressed. (HTTPS choose)  I fill email and password field. 

I pressed Login button. Accepted information and entered. But don't go back. Screen remains. if i press cancel button save button appear disabled mode.
fields.summary: Connect Account Bug

fields.description:
# Something is incorrect with the constraints on the vertical panel resizing UI widgets.  This doesn't seem to occur with all side-by-side content comparisons, but it happened for me with jpg and png.
 # Grab the panel resizing line just to the left of the images and drag it to the right.  The list of files collapses down to this.  
 # The only way to correct it is to hopefully have and guess a file that isn't an image comparison.

See below:

  !image-2018-08-04-10-29-04-593.png!
fields.summary: Fix resizing side-by-side image preview to not collapse file list

fields.description: All said. I would love to see support for GitLab server to add into accounts section in settings of SourceTree.
fields.summary: Support for GitLab Servers (self-hosted and cloud)
